parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique and case-sensitive identifier that you provide to make sure the idempotency of the request, so multiple identical calls have the same effect as one single call. A client token is valid for 8 hours after the first request that uses it completes. After 8 hours, any request with the same client token is treated as a new request. If the request succeeds, any future uses of that token will be idempotent for another 8 hours. If you submit a request with the same client token but change one of the other parameters within the 8-hour idempotency window, Directory Service Data returns an ConflictException. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: DirectoryId
parameters.description: The identifier (ID) of the directory that's associated with the group.

parameters.name: OtherAttributes
parameters.description: An expression that defines one or more attributes with the data type and value of each attribute. (string) --- (dict) --- The data type for an attribute. Each attribute value is described as a name-value pair. The name is the AD schema name, and the value is the data itself. For a list of supported attributes, see Directory Service Data Attributes. BOOL (boolean) --- Indicates that the attribute type value is a boolean. For example: "BOOL": true N (integer) --- Indicates that the attribute type value is a number. For example: "N": "16" S (string) --- Indicates that the attribute type value is a string. For example: "S": "S Group" SS (list) --- Indicates that the attribute type value is a string set. For example: "SS": ["sample_service_class/host.sample.com:1234/sample_service_name_1", "sample_service_class/host.sample.com:1234/sample_service_name_2"] (string) ---

nested_params.name: BOOL
nested_params.description: Indicates that the attribute type value is a boolean. For example: "BOOL": true.

nested_params.name: N
nested_params.description: Indicates that the attribute type value is a number. For example: "N": "16"

nested_params.name: S
nested_params.description: Indicates that the attribute type value is a string. For example: "S": "S Group"

nested_params.name: SS
nested_params.description: Indicates that the attribute type value is a string set. For example: "SS": ["sample_service_class/host.sample.com:1234/sample_service_name_1", "sample_service_class/host.sample.com:1234/sample_service_name_2"]

nested_items.name: DirectoryId
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the directory that's associated with the group.

nested_items.name: SID
nested_items.description: The unique security identifier (SID) of the group.
